publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1349# Patricia Ferguson: Evening Times Campaign - Fighting for a Fairer Deal from Property Managers—That the Parliament notes the problems faced by many home owners living in factored properties; considers that there is a clear requirement for legislation which will ensure that all property managers are registered and that access is available to a recognised form of mediation, and congratulates Glasgow’s Evening Times newspaper on its initiative in highlighting the issue and in pressing for reform of the system. Supported by: Cathy Peattie*, Elaine Murray*, Pauline McNeill*, Bill Butler*, Ken Macintosh*, Charlie Gordon*, John Park*, Dr Richard Simpson*

S3M-1349# Evening Times Campaign - Fighting for a Fairer Deal from Property Managers (lodged on 13 February 2008) Elaine Smith*, Jackie Baillie*, David Whitton*, Margaret Curran*, Paul Martin*, Mary Mulligan*, Andy Kerr*, Robin Harper*, Robert Brown*
S3M-1349# Evening Times Campaign - Fighting for a Fairer Deal from Property Managers (lodged on 13 February 2008) Cathie Craigie*, Karen Whitefield*, Jim Tolson*, Trish Godman*, Hugh O’Donnell*
S3M-1349# Evening Times Campaign - Fighting for a Fairer Deal from Property Managers (lodged on 13 February 2008) Patrick Harvie*, Mr Frank McAveety*
S3M-1349# Evening Times Campaign - Fighting for a Fairer Deal from Property Managers (lodged on 13 February 2008) Claire Baker*
